definition: to shoot a movie
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
trick/drama/play/show/CL:齣|出[chu1],場|场[chang3],臺|台[tai2]
variant of 戲|戏[xi4]

sentences.english: Chinese mainland part of the film and television industry friends want to shoot some students in my class.
sentences.chinese: 中国大陆几个影视界的朋友想让我班部分同学拍戏。

sentences.english: Off-camera the movie star liked to play chess.
sentences.chinese: 不拍戏时，那位电影明星喜欢下西洋棋。

sentences.english: When did you start to act?
sentences.chinese: 你什么时候开始拍戏的？

sentences.english: Ms. Li, in fact, is working alongside three very recognizable actors. Mr.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，李兴丽是在跟三位很著名的演员一起拍戏。

sentences.english: And I just try to get back into acting and really enjoy my life.
sentences.chinese: 我还是想拍戏，享受生活。

sentences.english: But when mentioning Sonija sank in a faint due to acting, Deric almost got mad.
sentences.chinese: 只是，提到郭羡妮拍戏晕倒的事，温兆伦就快气疯。

sentences.english: Coming back to Beijing I was welcome by the cold winter weather that I've become accustomed to on this production.
sentences.chinese: 然后马上又回到了北京郊区，在寒冷的冬天拍戏。

sentences.english: Filmed at La Sagrada Familia, Gaudi's masterpiece.
sentences.chinese: 在高迪的杰作“圣家族大教堂”拍戏。

sentences.english: But one accident almost ruins his career. It happened in his stunts.
sentences.chinese: 只是在拍戏过程中，一个小事故差点葬送了他的事业。

sentences.english: J: Being in town, and having this film, how is this feel for you?
sentences.chinese: 呆在这里拍戏，给你带来什么样的感觉呢？

sentences.english: S: When did you start to act?
sentences.chinese: 你什么时候开始拍戏的？

sentences.english: She said she wanted to continue her career after marriage but would not consider bearing a baby.
sentences.chinese: 她还表示希望婚后可以继续拍戏，并不打算生小孩。

sentences.english: When taking sport, ni Ping general " big ox " the child that treats oneself.
sentences.chinese: 拍戏时，倪萍将“大牛”视为自己的孩子。

definition: to accept an acting role
to put on a play/to perform/fig. to pretend/to feign
cast and crew/performers and production team
actor or actress/performer/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
show business
to make a movie
to check on sb at his workplace/to come to a movie set to visit one of the actors
movie contract
to play a small role
Shu Qi (1976-), Taiwanese actress
Li Bingbing (1973-), PRC film actress and pop star
substitute actor (esp. in fights of theatrical stunts)/stuntman
Li Lianjie or Jet Li (1963-), martial arts sportsman, subsequently film star and director
Cecilia Cheung (1980-), Hong Kong actress and pop singer
to succeed in life/to become somebody
Jackie Chan (1954-), kungfu film and Cantopop star
Ruby Lin (1976-), Taiwanese actress and pop singer
